## Useful Info

**Amaemon the Diabolical Poisoner** is a [unique](/Unique "Unique") [demonspawn](/Demonspawn "Demonspawn") with an [orange demon](/Orange_demon "Orange demon") friend, the ability to summon [scorpions](/Scorpion "Scorpion"), and a weakly enchanted [demon whip](/Demon_whip "Demon whip") of [venom](/Venom "Venom") (with a 1% of instead being [Snakebite](/Snakebite "Snakebite")). He tops this off with Concentrate Venom, increasing the power of all this poison.

## Spells

| Spell set I |                                                             |                                                     |
| :---------- | ----------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Concentrate Venom](/Concentrate_Venom "Concentrate Venom") | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot2       | [Summon Scorpions](/Summon_Scorpions "Summon Scorpions")    | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Location

- [Dungeon](/Dungeon "Dungeon"): 8-12
- [The Lair](/The_Lair "The Lair")
- [Orcish Mines](/Orcish_Mines "Orcish Mines"):1

## Tips & Tricks

- Poison resistance is highly recommended. If you don't have it, consider avoiding Amaemon until you find some; if that isn't an option, do your best to kill him as quickly as possible, preferably from a distance.
  - A [potion of resistance](/Potion_of_resistance "Potion of resistance") will help in a pinch. A [potion of lignification](/Potion_of_lignification "Potion of lignification") will also grant you rPois, but be careful where you turn into a tree -- you won't be able to move afterwards, and the orange demon can strike you from a distance.
- Much like other summoner/ally-focused monsters, aim to limit how many things can strike you during the fight. Retreating to a corridor or a [kill hole](/Kill_hole "Kill hole") will cut down on the poison you'll take. Killing Amaemon will remove the main threat from the fight -- an orange demon on its own tends to be a fairly easy foe.
- If you focus on using physical attacks, try not to close to melee range with Amaemon's orange demon ally; being [weakened](/Weak "Weak") means you'll take longer to kill Amaemon, giving him and his scorpions that much more time to inject lethal amounts of poison.
- Many characters, whether they were using [Maces & Flails](/Maces_%26_Flails "Maces & Flails") or not, will appreciate getting an early [demon whip](/Demon_whip "Demon whip") off of Amaemon. It might come with a small negative enchantment, but it's well worth using some [scrolls of enchant weapon](/Scrolls_of_enchant_weapon "Scrolls of enchant weapon") to beef it up.

## History

- Amaemon was introduced in [0.29](/0.29 "0.29").

Amaemon always knew he was different, but it was still a horrific surprise when his demonic heritage manifested. As his body twisted, Amaemon was forced to flee far from the surface. The passage of time has only left him more obsessed with what he has lost - consumed by poison both physical and spiritual.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Spells
  • 3 Location
  • 4 Tips & Tricks
  • 5 History

Useful Info

Amaemon the Diabolical Poisoner is a unique demonspawn with an orange demon friend, the ability to summon scorpions, and a weakly enchanted demon whip of venom (with a 1% of instead being Snakebite). He tops this off with Concentrate Venom, increasing the power of all this poison.

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Concentrate Venom Wizard flag
Slot2 Summon Scorpions Wizard flag

Location

  • Dungeon: 8-12
  • The Lair
  • Orcish Mines:1

Tips & Tricks

  • Poison resistance is highly recommended. If you don't have it, consider avoiding Amaemon until you find some; if that isn't an option, do your best to kill him as quickly as possible, preferably from a distance.
    • A potion of resistance will help in a pinch. A potion of lignification will also grant you rPois, but be careful where you turn into a tree -- you won't be able to move afterwards, and the orange demon can strike you from a distance.
  • Much like other summoner/ally-focused monsters, aim to limit how many things can strike you during the fight. Retreating to a corridor or a kill hole will cut down on the poison you'll take. Killing Amaemon will remove the main threat from the fight -- an orange demon on its own tends to be a fairly easy foe.
  • If you focus on using physical attacks, try not to close to melee range with Amaemon's orange demon ally; being weakened means you'll take longer to kill Amaemon, giving him and his scorpions that much more time to inject lethal amounts of poison.
  • Many characters, whether they were using Maces & Flails or not, will appreciate getting an early demon whip off of Amaemon. It might come with a small negative enchantment, but it's well worth using some scrolls of enchant weapon to beef it up.

History

  • Amaemon was introduced in 0.29.
